title: fenics package not installable
body:
If you want to report a build error for some package, or a bug in core please use the following template as a guideline:

-----

Summary

### Expected Result

Get FEniCS, a nice python/C++ finite element package working with spack. The package is already included in the builtin repository. 

### Actual Result

In a clean enviroment, without any install spack-package it the build fails with: 
```
$ spack install -v fenics@2016.1.0
==> Error: An unsatisfiable variant constraint has been detected for spec:

    hdf5@1.10.1%gcc@5.4.0~cxx~debug~fortran~hl+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^openmpi@3.0.0%gcc@5.4.0~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple~ucx+vt arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^hwloc
                ^pkgconf@1.4.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    netcdf+mpi
        ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@5.4.0+sigsegv arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^libsigsegv
        ^openmpi@3.0.0%gcc@5.4.0~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple~ucx+vt arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^hwloc
                ^pkgconf@1.4.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 


netcdf requires hdf5 variant +hl, but spec asked for ~hl
```

If the hdf5 support for fenics is turned of the error moves on to the petsc dependency: 
```
$ spack install -v fenics@2016.1.0 -hdf5
==> Error: An unsatisfiable variant constraint has been detected for spec:

    metis@5.1.0%gcc@5.4.0 build_type=Release ~gdb~int64~real64+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^cmake@3.10.1%gcc@5.4.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.4.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                ^pkgconf@1.4.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^openssl@1.0.2n%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    petsc@3.8.3%gcc@5.4.0+boost clanguage=C ~complex~debug+double+hdf5+hypre~int64+metis+mpi~mumps+shared+superlu-dist~trilinos arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^hdf5@1.8.9:+hl+mpi
            ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@5.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^hypre~int64~internal-superlu
            ^openblas@0.2.20%gcc@5.4.0 cpu_target= ~ilp64+pic+shared threads=none ~virtual_machine arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
        ^superlu-dist@5.2:5.2.99~int64
            ^metis@5.1.0%gcc@5.4.0 build_type=Release ~gdb~int64~real64+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                ^cmake@3.10.1%gcc@5.4.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                    ^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.4.0~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                        ^pkgconf@1.4.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                    ^openssl@1.0.2n%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
            ^openmpi@3.0.0%gcc@5.4.0~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple~ucx+vt arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
                ^hwloc
            ^parmetis@4.0.3%gcc@5.4.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~gdb+shared arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 


```

### Steps to reproduce the issue
Create an empty spack installation from the current git repository.
```console
$ spack install fenics@2016.1.0
$ spack install fenics@2016.1.0 -hdf5
```

### Information on your system
I work on a 

- Ubuntu 16.04 with gcc 5.4.0 (detected by spack) 
- x86_64
- no customizations in spack or its config.
